{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3420922,"name":"Daniel C.","username":"Daniel1464","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/6bbea6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-05T18:21:47.746Z","cooked":"

Recently, I have seen some teams(like 3015) use an UI application to replace the operator xbox/PS5 controller. However, most people on the (unofficial) FRC discord have said that it is a bad idea due to the lack of sensile feedback.

What are y’all’s thoughts on this topic? Would an operator dashboard be useful to you, or would it be suboptimal?

Daniel1464:

What are y’all’s thoughts on this topic? Would an operator dashboard be useful to you, or would it be suboptimal?

Show me it scores more points than the alternatives, and I’ll use it.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-09-05T18:22:37.750Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":211,"readers_count":210,"score":77.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":470770,"topic_slug":"thoughts-on-operator-displays-i-e-3015","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/thoughts-on-operator-displays-i-e-3015/470770/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3420924,"name":"Daniel C.","username":"Daniel1464","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/6bbea6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-05T18:24:29.038Z","cooked":"

I was thinking that it would be an easier learning curve for the operator, and allow them to do more things(I.E drive-to-pose, view telemetry, button tutorials, etc.).

Daniel1464:

thinking

Good hypothesis.

How would you design an experiment to prove your hypothesis true or false?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-09-05T18:26:14.829Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":190,"readers_count":189,"score":38.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":470770,"topic_slug":"thoughts-on-operator-displays-i-e-3015","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/thoughts-on-operator-displays-i-e-3015/470770/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3420928,"name":"Leo","username":"leo-les","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/leo-les/{size}/172390_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-05T18:31:07.021Z","cooked":"

Screens giving feedback to the driver/operator are good, and thats why dashboards(my team runs a custom one) exist, in order to show telemetry, subsystems status, or other indicators.

The reason I don’t like the screens being used as an input is the fear that in a match, the operator’s touch won’t register, or a different button on the screen is fat fingered. Distinct tactile inputs don’t have these same worries.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-09-05T18:31:07.021Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":169,"readers_count":168,"score":48.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":470770,"topic_slug":"thoughts-on-operator-displays-i-e-3015","display_username":"Leo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56324,"username":"Daniel1464","name":"Daniel C.","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/6bbea6/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53083,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3128 Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/thoughts-on-operator-displays-i-e-3015/470770/5","custom_user_title":"3128 Alumni","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3420934,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-05T19:03:12.233Z","cooked":"

Four other points to consider:

Does this screen allow you to get the operator up and running faster during build season and if so is this time saved usable (i.e. wasting time during build getting a controller to work when everything else is ready)

Is using a screen like this one of the desired learning outcome of the program/for some students?

How breakable / replaceable (cost, time) is the screen if it is relied on? (I have had too many scouting tablets break over the years to assume a screen is safe)

Is the operator looking at a screen at points during the match desirable? Or to put it another way, is there an advantage to be had for the operator taking their eyes off the robot mid match? Controllers and button boards use other sense to locate the operators fingers, screens are more difficult and may over rely on one sense.

Just food for thought; complicated doesn’t necessarily mean good, good doesn’t necessarily have to be complicated.
